Data standardization function

Source: R/data_standardization.R
data_standardization.Rd

This function standardizes the input data

Usage

data_standardization(raw_data)

Arguments

raw_data

input data

Value

The resulting dataset is the standardized data

Examples

dat = data_generate_MCAR(nsubj = 100, seed = 1234, n_miss = 5); head(dat$Y1[,1:5])
#>           [,1]       [,2]       [,3]       [,4]       [,5]
#> [1,] -1.455015  4.4325139 -0.1385899 -1.2657233 -0.3303383
#> [2,] -1.931601  3.6904397 -0.4001167 -0.6398729 -1.2939863
#> [3,]  0.110446 -0.8910078  2.9783519  0.4348456 -0.3905672
#> [4,] -2.875821  7.9262359 -0.4975126 -0.5333830  1.2906608
#> [5,] -1.421581  2.6181680 -1.0322329 -0.4958435 -1.1244439
#> [6,] -1.112864 -0.9087328  0.9203492 -0.5078019 -0.6922695
Y1_std = data_standardization(dat$Y1); head(Y1_std[,1:5])
#>            [,1]       [,2]       [,3]       [,4]       [,5]
#> [1,] -0.8931014  2.2520840 -0.1898521 -0.7919797 -0.2922863
#> [2,] -0.9755383  1.7309787 -0.2382638 -0.3536852 -0.6685832
#> [3,]  0.1016464 -0.4653495  1.7253765  0.2853126 -0.1820137
#> [4,] -1.0023704  2.6487308 -0.1985009 -0.2106252  0.4059027
#> [5,] -0.8105817  1.4103736 -0.5965278 -0.3016340 -0.6472232
#> [6,] -0.4687322 -0.3745449  0.4694016 -0.1895536 -0.2746678
